resources.string:
Thiki Wiki

 **Thiki Wiki for Android** is a notebook with linkable pages for tracking your ideas, tasks, projects, notes, brainstorms - in short, your life - in the most flexible way. 

 This software was derived from code written by Jan Willem Boer in 2010. This version is maintained by danny.ayers@gmail.com.

 This software is provided 'as-is', without any express or implied warranty. In no event will the author(s) be held liable for any damages arising from the use of this software.

 If you bought this software, this means you have bought a license, which allows you personally to use the software. So, if you buy a new Android device, or if you have two Android devices, you may install the software more than once. Please contact Danny Ayers in case of any trouble with this.

Home
======

This is the homepage for your personal wiki. You can edit this page by touching the Edit button in the toolbar.

 Create a link to a new or existing page by surrounding a word with curly brackets like {Todo}, or by using a WikiWord (a word with mixed casing).


To synchronize the wiki pages between this device and a desktop computer, enter your Dropbox credentials via 'Sync Settings' in the menu.


This wiki uses [Markdown formatting](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Markdown#Syntax_examples) for text editing.


Thiki Wiki is a notebook with linkable pages for tracking your ideas, tasks, projects, notes, brainstorms - in short, your life - in the most flexible way. If you have any further questions, don't hesitate to contact the developer at danny.ayers@gmail.com.
